articles.author: STEFANIE DAZIO, ETHAN SWOPE, JAKE OFFENHARTZ and JOSEPH B. FREDERICK
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Dueling groups of protesters clashed overnight at the University of California, Los Angeles, shoving, kicking and beating each other with sticks after pro-Israel demonstrators tried to pull down barricades surrounding a pro-Palestinian encampment.
articles.title: UCLA cancels classes after violence erupts on campus over the war in Gaza

articles.author: STEVE LeBLANC and NICK PERRY
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — Boston College students held a protest rally against the Israel-Hamas war last week. Bullhorns were banned, lest the noise disturb studying for finals.
articles.title: Student protests take over some campuses. At others, attention is elsewhere

articles.author: MATTHEW LEE, SAMY MAGDY and SAM MEDNICK
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with Israeli leaders Wednesday in his push for a cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas, saying “the time is now” for an agreement that would free hostages and bring a pause in the nearly seven months of war in Gaza.
articles.title: Blinken urges Israel and Hamas to move ahead with a cease-fire deal and says 'the time is now'

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON, SCOTT BAUER and MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: WAUKESHA, Wis. (AP) — Donald Trump on Wednesday is using a one-day break from his hush money trial to rally voters in the battleground states of Wisconsin and Michigan, a day after he was held in contempt of court and threatened with jail time for violating a gag order.
articles.title: Trump returns to his campaign facing a warning of jail time if he violates a trial gag order

articles.author: LISA MASCARO and KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene said Wednesday she would call a vote next week on ousting House Speaker Mike Johnson, forcing her colleagues to choose sides in a difficult showdown after Democratic leaders announced they would provide the votes to save the Republican speaker's job.
articles.title: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene vows to force a vote next week on ousting House Speaker Mike Johnson

articles.author: DAVID FISCHER and STEPHANY MATAT
articles.description: BOCA RATON, Fla. (AP) — Florida's ban on most abortions after six weeks of pregnancy, before many women even know they are pregnant, went into effect Wednesday, and some doctors are concerned that women in the state will no longer have access to needed health care.
articles.title: Florida's 6-week abortion ban takes effect as doctors worry women will lose access to health care

articles.author: PETER SMITH
articles.description: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — United Methodist delegates repealed their church’s longstanding ban on LGBTQ clergy with no debate on Wednesday, removing a rule forbidding “self-avowed practicing homosexuals” from being ordained or appointed as ministers.
articles.title: United Methodists repeal longstanding ban on LGBTQ clergy

articles.author: SOPHIKO MEGRELIDZE
articles.description: TBILISI, Georgia (AP) — Georgia's parliament on Wednesday moved a step closer to passing a law that critics fear will stifle media freedom and endanger the country's European Union membership bid, as tens of thousands of protesters thronged surrounding streets.
articles.title: Georgia moves closer to passing so-called 'Russian law' targeting media. Protesters gather again

articles.author: HANNAH SCHOENBAUM
articles.description: SALT LAKE CITY (AP) — Utah public schools have been rushing to prepare students and teachers as the state starts cracking down Wednesday on any school found not enforcing new bathroom restrictions for transgender people.
articles.title: Rollout of transgender bathroom law sows confusion among Utah public school families

articles.author: DAVID BAUDER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Even as many Americans say they learn about the 2024 election campaign from national news outlets, a disquieting poll reveals some serious trust issues.
articles.title: News organizations have trust issues as they gear up to cover another election, a poll finds
